dcterms:description: The JULES-INFERNO dataset simulates the area burned by fire and emissions over time, taking into account various geographical parameters including population density, land use, and weather conditions.
dcterms:title: JULES-INFERNO

dcterms:description: The JULES-INFERNO dataset includes model descriptions focusing on carbon fluxes and vegetation dynamics, essential for understanding the interactions between land use and fire dynamics.
dcterms:title: JULES-INFERNO

dcterms:description: The JULES-INFERNO dataset represents fire, land-use change, and vegetation dynamics, providing insights into how these factors influence wildfire behavior.
dcterms:title: JULES-INFERNO

dcterms:creator: S. Mangeon

dcterms:description: The JULES-INFERNO dataset includes a fire and emissions scheme for the UK Met Office’s Unified Model, crucial for understanding fire dynamics and emissions.
dcterms:title: JULES-INFERNO

dcterms:description: The JULES-INFERNO dataset is part of the Fire Modeling Intercomparison Project (FireMIP), providing experimental and analytical protocols with detailed model descriptions.
dcterms:title: JULES-INFERNO
